HOME-COMPONENT.START-OVERVIEW: Here is an overview of Intelcomp's Model Trainer
HOME-COMPONENT.CORPUS-DESCRIPTION: Use this space to select a corpus from the Data Lake to be used with the training of a model. You can also create a new corpus by merging other available ones or select a subcorpus based on a category.
HOME-COMPONENT.MODELS-DESCRIPTION: Use this space to select a model to work with create a new model, curate a model or manage the available models.
HOME-COMPONENT.STOPWORDS-EQUIVALENCES-DESCRIPTION: Use this space to manage your lists of stopwords and equivalences or create new ones.
HOME-COMPONENT.HOW-TO-CORPUS-DESCRIPTION: Create a new corpus or combine them

PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-TOPICS-MALLET: Number of topics for the model. A large number of topics will provide a higher level of detail, and will allow us to find some very specialized topics of small size. One drawback, however, is that larger topics can appear repetitive and fragmented. On the contrary, a small number of topics is useful to have a first approximation of the main topics of the corpus.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-TOPICS-SPARK: Number of topics for the model. A large number of topics will provide a higher level of detail, and will allow us to find some very specialized topics of small size. One drawback, however, is that larger topics can appear repetitive and fragmented. On the contrary, a small number of topics is useful to have a first approximation of the main topics of the corpus. This value is commonly referred to as parameter ‘k’ in Spark MLLIB documentation.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-TOPICS-AVITM: Number of topics for the model. A large number of topics will provide a higher level of detail, and will allow us to find some very specialized topics of small size. One drawback, however, is that larger topics can appear repetitive and fragmented. On the contrary, a small number of topics is useful to have a first approximation of the main topics of the corpus. This value is commonly referred to as ‘number of components’ in the AVITM implementation.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-TOPICS-CTM: Number of topics for the model. A large number of topics will provide a higher level of detail, and will allow us to find some very specialized topics of small size. One drawback, however, is that larger topics can appear repetitive and fragmented. On the contrary, a small number of topics is useful to have a first approximation of the main topics of the corpus. This value is commonly referred to as ‘number of components’ in the CTM implementation.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.ALPHA-MALLET: Hyperparameter for the Dirichlet distribution responsible for generating the topic vectors of the documents. A small value favors having few active topics per document; on the contrary, a high value will generally imply a greater number of active topics.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.ALPHA-SPARK: Hyperparameter for the Dirichlet distribution responsible for generating the topic vectors of the documents. A small value favors having few active topics per document; on the contrary, a high value will generally imply a greater number of active topics. This value is commonly referred to as parameter ‘docConcentration’ in Spark MLLIB documentation.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-ITERATIONS: Number of Gibbs sampling iterations. A common setting is 1000, although in order to have a rough first model it may be enough to use values ​​around 250.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.OPTIMIZE-INTERVAL: Number of Gibbs sampling iterations between reestimates of the hyperparameters of the probability distributions. If the parameter is set to 0, it implies that the initial values ​​will be preserved, and hyperparameters will not be optimized during model training.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.DOCUMENT-TOPICS-THRESHOLD: Threshold for pruning topics in the document representation matrix
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-THREADS: Number of threads for the parallel optimization of the algorithm.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MAX-ITERATIONS: Maximum number of iterations for the optimization algorithm
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.OPTIMIZER: The algorithm used for algorithm optimization. Two optimizers are available in Spark MLLIB LDA: Expectation-maximization (‘em’) and online variational Bayes Optimization (‘online’).
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.OPTIMIZE-DOC-CONCENTRATION: Whether the doc-concentration parameter alpha will be optimized during the training of the algorithm.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.SUBSAMPLING-RATE: Percentage of documents from the training set that will be used at every minibatch.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MODEL-TYPE-AVITM: The AVITM implementation used for training, namely ProdLDA or LDA.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MODEL-TYPE-CTM: The underlying AVITM implementation used for training, over which the contextualized topic model is constructed, namely ‘ProdLDA’ or ‘LDA’.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-EPOCHS: Number of complete passes through the training dataset over which the model will be trained. It can be set to an integer number between zero and infinity
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.BATCH-SIZE: Number of samples in the minibatch for neural network training.  It should have a value larger or equal to one and less or equal than the number of samples in the training dataset.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.THETAS-THRESHOLD: Threshold for topic activation in a doc (sparsification)
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.LABELS: Lists of labels to assign to topics
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.ACTIVATION: Activation function to be used, chosen from 'softplus', 'relu', 'sigmoid', 'leakyrelu', 'rrelu', 'elu', 'selu' or 'tanh'
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.DROPOUT: Percentage of neurons to drop out
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.LEARN-PRIORS: If true, priors are made learnable parameters
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.LR: Learning rate to be used for training
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MOMENTUM: Momentum to be used for training
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.SOLVER: NN optimizer to be used, chosen from 'adagrad', 'adam', 'sgd', 'adadelta' or 'rmsprop'
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.REDUCE-ON-PLATEAU: If true, reduce learning rate by 10x on plateau of 10 epochs
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-SAMPLES: Number of times the theta needs to be sampled
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-DALA-LOADER-WORKERS: Number of subprocesses to use for data loading
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.CTM-MODEL-TYPE: Type of the contextualized topic model, namely 'CombinedTM' or 'ZeroShotTM'
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.LOSS-WEIGHTS: Dictionary with the name of the weight parameter (key) and the weight (value) for each loss
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.SBERT-MODEL: Model to be used for calculating the embeddings. Available models at https://huggingface.co/models?library=sentence-transformers

PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.THR: The proportion of the expansion topic documents that a document must have to be kept in the 2-level model’s training corpus. Only used when the htm_version is ‘htm-ds’.
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.HTM: Hierarchical topic model algorithm under which the 2-level model’s training corpus is going to be generated, ‘htm-ws’ or ‘htm-ds’.

PREPROCESSING-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MIN-LEMMAS: Minimum number of words to keep document in corpus
PREPROCESSING-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NO-BELOW: Remove words with less than no_below occurrences
PREPROCESSING-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NO-ABOVE: Remove words appearing in more than a given percentage of documents
PREPROCESSING-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.KEEP-N: Maximum number of words in vocabulary

TOPICS-LISTING-COMPONENT.ADD-NEW-TOOLTIP: You have to select a root (not hierarchical) topic model and one of its topics first
TOPICS-LISTING-COMPONENT.LABEL: Label

PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.WEIGHTING-FACTOR: Weighting factor for the title components. Keyword matches with title words are weighted by this factor
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-ELEMENTS: Maximum number of elements in the output list. The default is a huge number that, in practice, means there is no limit
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MINIMUM-SCORE: Minimum score. Only elements strictly above s_min are selected
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MODEL-NAME: Name of the SBERT model. Available pretrained models can be found in https://www.sbert.net/docs/pretrained_models.html

PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-ELEMENTS: Maximum number of elements in the output list. The default is a huge number that, in practice, means there is no limit
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MINIMUM-SCORE: Minimum score. Only elements strictly above s_min are selected

PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NUMBER-OF-ELEMENTS: Maximum number of elements in the output list. The default is a huge number that, in practice, means there is no limit
PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MINIMUM-SCORE: Minimum score. Only elements strictly above s_min are selected

CLASSIFIER-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MODEL-TYPE: Type of transformer for ClassificationModel (e.g. roberta, mpnet), see https://simpletransformers.ai/docs/classification-specifics/#supported-model-types
CLASSIFIER-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MODEL-NAME: Name of the simpletransformer model (e.g. roberta_base, all-mpnet-base-v2)
CLASSIFIER-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.MAX-IMBALANCE: Maximum ratio negative vs positive samples in the training set
CLASSIFIER-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.NMAX: Maximum number of documents in the training set
CLASSIFIER-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.FREEZE-ENCODER: If True, the embedding layer is fixed, and not fine-tuned. During learning, only the layers after the encoder of the sentence transformer are updated

ACTIVE-LEARNING-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.N-DOCS: Number of docs to show each AL round
ACTIVE-LEARNING-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.P-RATIO: Ratio of high-score samples. The rest will be low-score samples. (Used for sampler='extremes' only)
ACTIVE-LEARNING-PARAMETERS-TOOLTIPS.TOP-PROB: (Approximate) probability of selecting the doc with the highest score in a single sampling. This parameter is used to control the randomness of the stochastic sampling: if top_prob=1, the samples with the highest score are taken deterministically. top_prob=0 is equivalent to random sampling. (Used for sampler='extremes' only)

NEW-KEYWORD-MANUALLY-DIALOG.ADD-KEYWORD-HINT: Insert a keyword and append it to keywords list
